meanings.definition: Having a crimped or wavy texture.
meanings.sent1: The crispated edges of the paper added a nice touch to the craft project.
meanings.sent2: Her hair looked crispated after she braided it and slept on it overnight.
meanings.sent3: The crispated potato chips were a hit at the party, everyone loved the unique texture.
meanings.sent4: The crispated waves of the ocean sparkled under the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The crispated leaves rustled in the gentle breeze, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: To make something crimped or wavy.
meanings.sent1: She crispated the ribbon before tying it around the gift box.
meanings.sent2: The chef crispated the edges of the pie crust for a decorative finish.
meanings.sent3: He crispated the fabric to give it a more interesting look.
meanings.sent4: The artist crispated the paper to create a unique texture for the artwork.
meanings.sent5: The hairstylist crispated her hair for a trendy and textured look.
